heatmap.title: Trichogramma Density Distribution
heatmap.descriptionLong: Mathematical distribution models showing insect dispersal patterns - Configure parameters and generate visualization
heatmap.distributionMethodDescription: Choose the mathematical model for trichogramma insect dispersal patterns
heatmap.distributionGaussianDescription: Standard bell curve distribution. Best for typical short-range dispersal (mean radius ~8m). Research-validated for trichogramma releases.
heatmap.distributionLevyFlightDescription: Power-law distribution with occasional long-distance dispersal. Models optimal foraging behavior with fat tails for rare long jumps.
heatmap.distributionExponentialDescription: Simple distance-limited dispersal with consistent decay rate. Good for intermediate-range movement patterns.
heatmap.sigmaTooltip: Controls how tightly insects are distributed around each drop point. Lower values = more concentrated, higher values = more spread out distribution.
heatmap.levyAlphaTooltip: Stability parameter controlling tail heaviness. Lower values (1.0-1.5) = more long jumps, higher values (1.5-2.0) = more Gaussian-like behavior
heatmap.exponentialLambdaDescription: Controls how quickly density decreases with distance
heatmap.exponentialLambdaTooltip: Decay rate parameter. Higher values = faster decay (shorter dispersal), lower values = slower decay (longer dispersal)
heatmap.maxDistanceTooltip: Maximum distance insects can travel from drop points. Beyond this distance, insect density becomes negligible. Affects computation performance.
heatmap.insectsPerDropTooltip: Number of trichogramma insects released at each drop point. Higher values increase overall density calculations and tooltip insect counts.
heatmap.resolutionTooltip: Increases canvas rendering resolution for sharper heatmaps. Higher values provide better quality but require more computation time and memory.
heatmap.gpuNotSupported: WebGPU not supported in this browser
heatmap.processing: This may take a moment for large files
